    the climax

    i’m almost at the end of a cliffhanger and the doorbell chimes. i try to grab just another sentence. it chimes again; this time twice in quick succession. “wait up”, i mutter under my breath and make a bolt for the door in order to wind up the business in a jiffy and return to the book.

    the golgappa

    yes, a valid passport of india does warrant your citizenship but if you haven’t tasted the most famous food the streets of this country have to offer then i see no reason to christen you as a compatriot.

    regret

    i never quite had any regret in life until i got married. i do not mean to say that I regret getting married to the person i’m currently married to but I regret not getting married to her a decade ago when i attained the legal marriageable age.
